theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic changes, loss of protein homeostasis, and systemic metabolic/inflammatory factors impairing stem cell function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteostasis failure, metabolic shifts, and niche heterogeneity affecting stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis and metabolic dysregulation causing muscle stem cell senescence and exhaustion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details satellite cell quiescence, proteostasis, and exercise-mediated activation preventing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on niche deterioration, metabolic regulation, autophagy, and signaling pathways (FOXO, TOR) in stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights intrinsic/extrinsic factors including niche signaling and systemic metabolic pathways affecting stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetic and epigenetic regulation, DNA damage, and intrinsic/extrinsic factors influencing stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates intrinsic and extrinsic mechanisms including DNA damage, telomere attrition, epigenetics, and altered signaling pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Defines hallmarks of stem cell aging including intrinsic/extrinsic stressors and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p19Arf/p53 pathway and epigenetic regulation driving neural stem cell senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes stem cell senescence, DNA damage, epigenetic alterations, and cell cycle arrest as aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: TAp63 regulation of stem cell senescence and exhaustion via DNA damage and cell cycle control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Sox4 transcription factor modulates stem cell activation, quiescence, DNA damage, and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis and Metabolic Dysregulation-Driven Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hydra stem cell maintenance via protein homeostasis and FoxO regulation linked to negligible senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTORC1 and Nutrient Signaling-Mediated Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTORC1 hyperactivation drives mesenchymal stem cell exhaustion and bone aging in Klotho-deficient mice.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTORC1 and Nutrient Signaling-Mediated Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stem cell pool depletion and microenvironmental changes affecting stem cell homeostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTORC1 and Nutrient Signaling-Mediated Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stem cell niche aging, altered signaling pathways (Notch, MAPK, TGF-β), and cell cycle control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTORC1 and Nutrient Signaling-Mediated Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Reviews age-related decline in stem cell function including microenvironmental and signaling alterations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTORC1 and Nutrient Signaling-Mediated Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Intrinsic stem cell aging and environmental signaling changes impair regenerative capacity, e.g. remyelination.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Progenitor Cell Exhaustion in Vascular and Bone Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Decline in endothelial progenitor cells and osteoblast replicative capacity leads to vascular aging and osteoporosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Progenitor Cell Exhaustion in Vascular and Bone Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Age-related osteoblast replicative exhaustion (ARORC) causes bone fragility and fracture risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Progenitor Cell Exhaustion in Vascular and Bone Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Circulating progenitor cell depletion precedes diabetes, linking reparative exhaustion to metabolic disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Progenitor Cell Exhaustion in Vascular and Bone Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mesenchymal stem cell exhaustion contributes to frailty and inflammation-related aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Exhaustion and Clonal Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: HSC exhaustion with DNA damage, telomere shortening, and niche changes causes anemia and myeloid bias.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Exhaustion and Clonal Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Selection of apoptosis-resistant HSC subpopulations with increased ABC transporter activity during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Exhaustion and Clonal Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Pan-tissue decline in stemness with functional deterioration rather than numeric loss, including HSCs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Stem Cell Exhaustion and Functional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Decline in stem cell populations and function systemically drives organismal aging; young stem cell transplantation as therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Stem Cell Exhaustion and Functional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Balance between stem cell regenerative capacity and damage accumulation; telomere shortening drives exhaustion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Stem Cell Exhaustion and Functional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Elevated cell death and insufficient stem cell replacement cause tissue degeneration and aging.
